term.name: objectivism
term.source: From Latin objectum: that which is presented to consciousness.
term.def: The doctrine that reality exists outside of the mind and that entities retain their identity no matter what human beings think or feel about them; another word for &realism;, in opposition to &subjectivism;.
The view that there are standards of value and conduct based on the reality of human nature; another term for &naturalism;.
The self-described name for the philosophy of Ayn Rand (1905–1982), usually with a capital 'O'.
